articles.title: Boston Celtics acquire Malcolm Brogdon in trade with Indiana Pacers, sources say
articles.description: The Celtics acquired playmaking point guard Malcom Brogdon in a trade with the Pacers without having to give up a core player, sources told ESPN. The Pacers landed another first-round pick in the deal.
articles.content:
The Indiana Pacers are trading guard Malcolm Brogdon to the Boston Celtics, sources told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski on Friday.
The Celtics are sending Daniel Theis, Aaron Nesmith and a 2023 first-rou… [+646 chars]

articles.author: Adrian WojnarowskiSenior NBA Insider
articles.title: Sources -- Atlanta Hawks trade Kevin Huerter to Sacramento Kings for Justin Holiday, Mo Harkless, future first-round pick
articles.description: The Sacramento Kings have acquired sharpshooter Kevin Huerter from the Atlanta Hawks in return for Justin Holiday, Mo Harkless and a top-14 protected first-round pick in 2024, sources tell ESPN.
articles.content:
The Sacramento Kings reached a deal to acquire Atlanta Hawks guard Kevin Huerter for a 2024 protected first-round pick and two players on Friday, sources told ESPN.

articles.title: Baltimore Ravens' Jaylon Ferguson died from combined effects of fentanyl, cocaine, officials say
articles.description: The Maryland Department of Heath said the death of Ravens linebacker Jaylon Ferguson on June 21 was ruled an accident. He was 26.
articles.content:
OWINGS MILLS, Md. -- Baltimore Ravens outside linebacker Jaylon Ferguson died from the combined effects of fentanyl and cocaine, according to medical examiners on Friday.

articles.title: Jusuf Nurkic, Portland Trail Blazers agree to four-year, $70M contract for return, agent says
articles.description: Free-agent center Jusuf Nurkic has agreed to a four-year, $70 million deal to stay with the Trail Blazers, with whom he averaged 15.0 points and 11.1 rebounds per game last season.
articles.content:
Free-agent center Jusuf Nurkic has agreed to a four-year, $70 million deal to stay with the Portland Trail Blazers, Klutch Sports CEO Rich Paul told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski.

articles.title: Chicago Bulls, Zach LaVine agree to 5-year, $215M max contract extension
articles.description: The Chicago Bulls and Zach LaVine agreed to a five-year, $215M max contract extension, Klutch Sports announced on Friday.
articles.content:
The Chicago Bulls and Zach LaVine have agreed to a five-year, $215M max contract extension, Klutch Sports announced Friday.

articles.title: Bruce Brown, Denver Nuggets reach 2-year deal worth more than $13 million, sources say
articles.description: Bruce Brown, a versatile defender who was used primarily as a screener and rim-roller for a talented Nets team that did not require his ballhandling skills, has reached a two-year deal with the Nuggets, sources told ESPN.
articles.content:
Bruce Brown has agreed to a two-year deal with the Denver Nuggets worth more than $13 million, sources told ESPN's Malika Andrews on Friday.

articles.description: Mitchell Robinson, a block- and dunk-heavy big man, has agreed to a four-year, $60 million contract to stay with the Knicks, his agents told ESPN.

articles.title: Cleveland Cavaliers reach three-year, $18M deal to bring back Ricky Rubio, agents say
articles.description: Free-agent guard Ricky Rubio has agreed to a three-year, $18 million deal to return to the Cavaliers, his agents told ESPN. Rubio played for the Cavaliers last season before suffering an ACL tear and being traded to the Pacers.
